app_description.message: A customizable password protected website blocker and redirector

options_master_password_comment.message: Enter a master password to protect editing

options_allow_access.message: Allow access to the unblocked hostname for (in seconds)

options_block_period.message: Block password check when wrong password is entered multiple times (in minutes)

options_sup_1.message: URL of a local (file://) or remote (http:// or https://) page to be displayed when a tab access is blocked. If no URL is specified (recommended), the built-in page is displayed.

options_sup_2.message: This is a custom message that is shown on blocked tabs. Could be the instruction to open the blocked page or administration contact

options_sup_3.message: Uncheck this option if you don't want any data to be sent to the remote server. This option is useful if you are using this extension to prevent any network access to some hostnames.

options_sup_4.message: Use zero number to prevent the automatic closing of the blocked pages

options_sup_5.message: If enabled, only URLs with a matching pattern can be browsed; all other hostnames are getting blocked

options_sup_6.message: To block a keyword add the following rules: '*://*keyword*/*' (blocks domains with the keyword) and '*://*/*keyword*' (blocks all domains with the keyword query). If you are familiar with regular expressions, you can prepare your own rules by prepending 'R:' keyword to the rule. For instance to block www.google.com on both HTTP and HTTPS protocols, use a rule like 'R:ht{2}ps*://.*\.go{2}gle\.com'. If you just need to close a page with this rule, use 'close' keyword in the 'Redirect To' box.

options_sup_7.message: This will cause to block all pages that match your blocking rules on the browser startup

options_sup_8.message: Sample import file format. This file need to be a *.TXT file. After importing, you will still need to press the save button for the changes to take place. So if for any reason the imported list is not what you are looking for, simply close and reopen the options page.

options_sup_9.message: The exported JSON file contains your master password. Do not share this file.

options_sup_10.message: When importing settings, all your existing settings will be overwritten.

options_sup_11.message: You can limit the schedule to be applied only on a few hostnames by providing a matching rule. This rule is a regular expression that is checked per URL. The schedule only applies if the URL matches the rule. Note that to edit schedules with rules, enter the rule in this box so that the extension loads the rule for you. To delete a schedule with a rule, insert the rule here so that the extension loads the relevant schedule first, then delete the time section without removing the rule itself and press the save button. Alternatively, export all settings to a JSON file and modify the list with a text editor then import the list back.

blocked_master_password.message: Enter the master password to unblock

blocked_no_action.message: Master password is not correct. Fill the box and retry

bg_msg_1.message: This tab doesn't have a valid URL

bg_msg_3.message: Go to the options page and set a master password

bg_msg_4.message: Too many wrong passwords. Please wait for ## minute(s) and retry.

bg_msg_12.message: Please enter the master password to pause blocking
